sentences: Born in Japan to a Japanese father (Masahito Iwamoto) and an American mother (Marguerite, nee Magruder).
She stayed there in a year and half, and took lesson of George Enescu in Chicago, and Louis Persinger in New York at The Juilliard School.

In addition, She founded the Iwamoto Mari String Quartet in 1967, with violinist Tomoda Yoshiaki, viola player Suganuma Junji and cellist Kuranuma Toshio; the quartet won a special prize at the Suntory Music Award in 1979, shortly prior to Mari's death from cancer on 11 May 1979.
